---
title: 'Support'
description: 'Get help with NOMOS - support channels, resources, and contact information'
---
Need help with NOMOS? We're here to assist you! This page outlines all the ways you can get support, from self-service resources to direct contact with our team.

    ### Debugging Resources
    - Log analysis guide
    - Common error patterns
    - Performance profiling
    - Memory usage optimization
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Community Support

### Discord Server

Join our active Discord community for real-time help and discussion:

<Steps>
  <Step title="Join the Server">
    Click [here](https://discord.gg/dowhiledev) to join our Discord server
  </Step>
  <Step title="Choose Your Channels">
    - `#general` - General discussion and introductions
    - `#help` - Get help with NOMOS issues
    - `#showcase` - Share your projects
    - `#development` - Technical discussions
    - `#announcements` - Project updates
  </Step>
  <Step title="Introduce Yourself">
    Tell us about your background and what you're building with NOMOS
  </Step>
  <Step title="Get Help">
    Ask questions, share code, and get real-time assistance
  </Step>
</Steps>

## Issue Reporting

### Bug Reports

Found a bug? Help us fix it by providing detailed information:

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Before Reporting">
    1. **Search existing issues** to avoid duplicates
    2. **Update to latest version** to see if it's already fixed
    3. **Test with minimal example** to isolate the issue
    4. **Check the FAQ** for common problems
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Information to Include">
    - **NOMOS version**: `pip show nomos`
    - **Python version**: `python --version`
    - **Operating system**: Windows/macOS/Linux + version
    - **LLM provider**: OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.
    - **Complete error message** and stack trace
    - **Minimal code example** that reproduces the issue
    - **Expected vs actual behavior**
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Bug Report Template">
    ```markdown
    ## Bug Description
    A clear description of what the bug is.

    ## To Reproduce
    1. Step 1
    2. Step 2
    3. Error occurs

    ## Expected Behavior
    What you expected to happen.

    ## Environment
    - NOMOS version:
    - Python version:
    - OS:
    - LLM provider:

    ## Additional Context
    Any other relevant information.
    ```
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

### Feature Requests

Have an idea for a new feature? We'd love to hear it:

<Steps>
  <Step title="Check Roadmap">
    Review our [roadmap](https://github.com/dowhiledev/nomos/projects) to see if it's already planned
  </Step>
  <Step title="Search Existing Requests">
    Check if someone has already requested this feature
  </Step>
  <Step title="Create Detailed Request">
    Use our [feature request template](https://github.com/dowhiledev/nomos/issues/new?template=feature_request.md)
  </Step>
  <Step title="Engage with Community">
    Participate in discussions and help refine the idea
  </Step>
</Steps>

<Info>
Interested in enterprise support? Contact our team at [enterprise@dowhile.dev](mailto:enterprise@dowhile.dev) to discuss your needs and get a custom quote.

## Support Response Times

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Community Support">
    ### Free Community Support
    - **Discord**: Typically within a few hours during business hours
    - **GitHub Issues**: 1-3 business days for initial response
    - **GitHub Discussions**: 1-2 business days
    - **Email**: 3-5 business days

    <Warning>
    Community support is provided on a best-effort basis by volunteers and maintainers.
    </Warning>
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Enterprise Support">
    ### Paid Enterprise Support
    - **Critical Issues**: 2-4 hours
    - **High Priority**: 8-12 hours
    - **Normal Priority**: 1-2 business days
    - **Low Priority**: 3-5 business days

    ### Support Channels
    - Dedicated email address
    - Private Discord channel
    - Direct phone support (premium tier)
    - Video conference support
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Getting Better Help

### Provide Context

Help us help you by providing complete information:

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Code Examples">
    - Share the actual code that's causing issues
    - Include relevant configuration files
    - Provide input/output examples
    - Use code blocks for formatting
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Error Messages">
    - Include the complete error message
    - Share the full stack trace
    - Note when the error occurs
    - Mention any error patterns
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Environment Details">
    - Operating system and version
    - Python version and virtual environment
    - NOMOS version and installation method
    - LLM provider and model being used
    - Any relevant dependencies
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

### Communication Guidelines

<Steps>
  <Step title="Be Specific">
    Provide clear, detailed descriptions of your issue or question
  </Step>
  <Step title="Be Patient">
    Our team and community volunteers help in their spare time
  </Step>
  <Step title="Be Respectful">
    Follow our code of conduct and treat everyone with respect
  </Step>
  <Step title="Follow Up">
    Provide feedback on solutions and close issues when resolved
  </Step>
</Steps>

### Learning Resources

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Beginner">
    - Complete the [Getting Started](/getting-started) guide
    - Try the [Playground](https://nomos-builder.vercel.app/)
    - Read the [FAQ](/faq) for common questions
    - Join Discord and introduce yourself
    - Start with simple examples from the cookbook
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Intermediate">
    - Study the [Flow Management](/flow-management) guide
    - Experiment with different [LLM providers](/llm-support)
    - Build custom tools and functions
    - Deploy your first agent to production
    - Contribute to community discussions
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Advanced">
    - Dive into the source code on GitHub
    - Contribute to the project
    - Build complex multi-agent systems
    - Optimize for production performance
    - Help mentor other community members
  </Tab>
</Tabs>
